column4: People my driver seems to be broken and I'm getting segmentation faults, I need some help
Graphics card driver
When running glxinfo I am getting errors and segmentation faults, anyone?
glxinfo is giving me errors and segmentation faults
I'm assuming segmentation faults are bad, if so I have a big problem right?
Let me rephrase. Are segmentation faults bad? If so HOW bad......
Segmentation fault = linux kills a process because that process attempted to use memory it's not allowed to.
Why would glxinfo use memory it isn't allowed to?
it means the programmer made a mistake
Isn't glxinfo built into err Linux/Ubuntu?
You get a segfault when, for example, you try to access the 11th item of a 10-item array. (and the memory after it is not segmented for writing/reading)
drivers probably not loading up correctly. Which brand?
ATI
Ca't help, I have no experience with them
Also, did you update your kernel lately?
have you rebooted your machine since?
Not that I know of
there was an update on the apt repo not long ago, perhaps you installed it. That would make the drivers not work until the machine is rebooted once.
See above, I have restarted numerous times
I'd try reinstalling the drivers
segfault just means the software is crashing and linux kills it to save itself from it.
